extensionDescription.message: Displays selected tabs in a split view, either in a new tab or in new windows.

optionsModeWindowDescription.message: Creates new browser windows. Preserves all features (address bar, ad blockers, etc.).

optionsModeTabDescription.message: Displays everything in a single tab. Elegant look, but ad blockers and address bar history do not work.

welcomeSubtitle.message: Here's a quick guide to mastering multi-tab productivity.

welcomeHeader1.message: 1. Create Your First Split View (Tab Mode)

welcomeStep1_1.message: Select 2 to 4 tabs by holding Cmd (Mac) or Ctrl (Windows) and clicking on them.

welcomeStep1_2.message: Click the extension's icon in your toolbar.

welcomeStep1_3.message: That's it! A new tab opens with your pages side-by-side.

welcomeStep2_1.message: Name Your View: Click the field at the top of the split view (e.g., "Split - 123...") and give it a clear name like "Project X Research".

welcomeStep2_2.message: Remove a Panel: Click the small × button to the right of a panel's address bar to remove it.

welcomeStep2_3.message: Close the Whole View: Click the large X button at the top right.

welcomeHeader3.message: 3. Add a Tab to an Existing View

welcomeStep3_2.message: Go to another tab you wish to add.

welcomeStep3_4.message: In the menu, go to "Add to an existing Split View..." and choose your view by its name.

welcomeFooter.message: Tip: Prefer views to open in separate windows? Go to the extension options and choose "Window Tiling Mode".

welcomeWarningP1.message: Some websites (banks, social networks, addons.mozilla.org, etc.) have security features that prevent them from being displayed inside another page (in an iframe).

welcomeWarningP2.message: When you try to split these sites in 'Single Tab Mode', you will see an error like this:

welcomeWarningP3.message: To work around this, Super Split View will automatically open these views in 'Window Tiling Mode'. You can also manually add the relevant domains to a list on the extension's options page.
